thread.title: Ivanka Trump Says She Won’t Serve As Trump Administration’s First Lady
thread.title_full: Ivanka Trump Says She Won’t Serve As Trump Administration’s First Lady

author: Jack Davis
title: Ivanka Trump Says She Won’t Serve As Trump Administration’s First Lady
text:
Trump: Twitter Best Way To Counteract ‘Dishonest Press’ 
Although Ivanka has said her first priority will be her family as she, husband Jared Kushner, and their three children transition from New York City to Washington, she also made it clear that she will not simply be a bystander. 
“My father will be president, and hopefully, I can be there to support him and to support those causes I’ve cared about my whole professional career,” she said. Although Ivanka has said she does not plan to have a formal role in the Trump administration, her husband will serve as a senior adviser to her father. 
During the interview, Ivanka noted that she will continue in her friendship with former first daughter Chelsea Clinton, and turn to her for advice. The two women had become friends in New York City, but their friendship was put on the back burner during the hard-fought presidential campaign between Trump and Hillary Clinton.   
Ivanka noted that she will miss her New York City office and her roles as an executive vice president with the Trump Organization and the head of her brand of clothing and jewelry. 
“It’s emotional that I’m stepping away from my business,” she said. 
Although Ivanka has said she will not serve as a first lady substitute, experts expect she will remain a highly public figure. 
Historian Carl Sferrazza Anthony of the National First Ladies Library in Canton, Ohio., likened Ivanka Trump to Julie Nixon Eisenhower.
